item.title: Understanding Merkle Trees
item.content:encoded: Learn what Merkle trees are, how they work, and why this elegant data structure is critical to Git, blockchains, cloud sync, and secure systems at scale.

item.title: Is a Computer Science Degree Still Valuable in the Age of AI?
item.content:encoded: Kirupa Chinnathambi and Elisa Cundiff discuss how AI is transforming computer science education, the role of critical thinking, and the shifting value of a CS degree in today‚Äôs tech landscape.

item.title: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) Explained
item.content:encoded: Learn about MCP and what makes it the "USB-C for AI".

item.title: Vibe Coding + Expertise = Mega Win! üèÜ
item.content:encoded: Vibe coding can help you go far, but the best winning combination is one where you combine vibe coding with deep expertise of what good code should look like.

item.title: Animating our Grid
item.content:encoded: Learn the necessary animation techniques to turn our static grid into an animated one, with DPI and frame-rate awareness built-in.

item.title: Counting in Negabinary (aka Base (-2))
item.content:encoded: Master negabinary (base ‚Äì2) with visual examples! Learn how to count, convert, and do math without sign bits in this fun guide to negative-base numbers.

item.title: Counting in Binary and Hexadecimal
item.content:encoded: Up your cool game by learning all about our base-2 and base-16 friends, the binary and hexadecimal numbers.

item.title: Pascal Pixel on Design, Development, and Solopreneurship!
item.content:encoded: Hi everybody - In my latest chat, meet Pascal Pixel - a very talented designer, developer, and solopreneur. He has been tinkering in this space from a very early age and has a slew of fantastic projects that he can assign his name to, including his current project, the uniquely named Horse Browser.

item.title: Do we really need to know how things work? üß†
item.content:encoded: With AI, is everything we are learning (or have learned) destined to be relegated to a "trivial knowledge" heap?

item.title: Drawing Sharp Lines on the Canvas
item.content:encoded: Ensure crisp and sharp lines by understanding the relationship between line position and line thickness/width.

item.title: The KIRUPA Tech Stack : It's 1998 All Over Again!
item.content:encoded: The KIRUPA site serves its millions of visitors from a toaster in the basement of an empty warehouse. To find out how much of this is true, you'll have to read on.

item.title: Bloom Filter: A Friendly Deep Dive
item.content:encoded: Learn how to quickly check if a value exists in a ridiculously large collection of data by using the world's favorite little probabilistic data structure, the Bloom filter.

item.title: Hash Functions Deep Dive
item.content:encoded: Learn all about what hash functions are and how they work to keep hashtables (and related data structures) running, protect your passwords, verify downloads, and keep the digital world running smoothly. A clear explanation of hashing for everyone...and their pets!

item.title: Advanced Glitch Effect with Sound
item.content:encoded: A fun coding exercise that goes deep into advanced Canvas-related JS topics.

item.title: AI Killed the Content Creator...Star ü§©
item.content:encoded: As Generative AI becomes faster and better, does the world need content creators?

item.title: Measuring the Distance Between Two Points by using the Pythagorean Theorem
item.content:encoded: Learn how to measure the distance between two points by using the Pythagorean theorem.

item.title: Detecting Browser Zoom Changes in JavaScript
item.content:encoded: Learn a clever approach towards detecting browser zoom changes by using the browser size and viewport size to help!

item.title: Creating a Fullscreen Grid
item.content:encoded: Learn how to take a simple grid and modify it to take up all available space in the browser. As always, some surprises await!

item.title: Drawing a Perfect Grid on the Canvas
item.content:encoded: Learn how to create crisp, responsive grids using the HTML5 Canvas and JavaScript. We cover all sorts of fun stuff like grid mathematics, DPI handling, and a boatload more.

item.title: Preserving the Pixel Art Look in Web Content
item.content:encoded: Learn essential CSS techniques, scaling strategies, and design principles that preserve the crisp, totally-cool aesthetic of pixel art across high-resolution displays and responsive web environments.

item.title: Ensuring our Canvas Looks Good on Retina/High-DPI Screens
item.content:encoded: Learn how to implement some sweet downsampling techniques to ensure what we create on the canvas looks sharp and crisp even on high-DPI screens.

item.title: Finding Prime Numbers Using a Sieve of Eratosthenes
item.content:encoded: Learn how the Sieve of Eratosthenes algorithm finds prime numbers using a simple sifting technique, similar to a kitchen sieve. Includes step-by-step visualization, JavaScript implementation, and beginner-friendly explanation of this ancient yet powerful mathematical method.

item.title: Video: Two-Dimensional (2D) Arrays in JavaScript
item.content:encoded: In this video, you'll learn how to create, access, and manipulate 2D arrays in JavaScript using both traditional as well as modern ES6-based approaches.

item.title: Two-Dimensional (2D) Arrays in JavaScript
item.content:encoded: Learn how to create, access, and manipulate 2D arrays in JavaScript. Discover practical examples, visualization techniques, and modern ES6 approaches for working with multi-dimensional data.

item.title: Animations: From Biology to JavaScript! ü¶†
item.content:encoded: The Cluster Growth Animation is a great example of an animation that mimics biological processes instead of following the more common physics-based path.

item.title: You‚Äôll Always be Building and Designing
item.content:encoded: What you do early in your career compared to what you do later in your career has some strong overlap. The output will change, but the core building and designing activities will not. Let's dive into this.

item.title: Creating a Cluster Growth Animation
item.content:encoded: Learn how to recreate a biological cell growth simulation using JavaScript and HTML5 Canvas. This comprehensive guide covers the conceptual foundations of cluster growth, explains the implementation details step-by-step, and provides insights on customizing the animation's appearance. Perfect for web developers interested in creative coding and simulating natural phenomena.

item.title: Timsort: A Lightning Fast Hybrid Sorting Algorithm
item.content:encoded: Meet Timsort, a hybrid sorting algorithm used in Python and Java. This beginner-friendly guide breaks down its workings, advantages, and how to implement it for optimal performance.

item.title: Merge Sort: A Simple Step-by-Step Walkthrough üòÄ
item.content:encoded: Merge Sort is pretty great for sorting all sorts of values. Seriously! There isn‚Äôt a whole lot to say that is bad about it. It is performant with consistent O(n log n) time complexity, reasonable storage needs, and it also happens to be stable!

item.title: Bubble Sort: A Video Deep-Dive üõÅ
item.content:encoded: Bubble sort is a simple sorting algorithm that repeatedly steps through a list, compares adjacent elements, and swaps them if they are in the wrong order. Learn all about it in this video

item.title: Bubble Sort: A Detailed Deep-Dive üõÅ
item.content:encoded: Bubble sort is a simple sorting algorithm that repeatedly steps through a list, compares adjacent elements, and swaps them if they are in the wrong order. Learn all about what makes it tick and why we probably don't want to use it for larger datasets.

item.title: Insertion Sort: A Deep Dive! üç£
item.content:encoded: Confused about insertion sort? No worries! This video and article break it down step-by-step. You'll be sorting data like a pro using insertion sort in no time.

item.title: Selection Sort: A Step-by-Step Guide üí¨
item.content:encoded: Learn all about selection sort and its intuitive, almost human-like, approach for sorting values.

item.title: Radix Sort: A Complete Video to Fast and Efficient Sorting! ‚ö°Ô∏è
item.content:encoded: Discover Radix Sort, a fast and efficient algorithm for sorting integers. This video explains how it works, its benefits, and why it is a better option than Counting Sort.

item.title: Career Growth Secrets
item.content:encoded: To grow in their career, why do many senior people switch jobs regularly? What is the secret to being successful early in your career? We cover all this and more in this article.

item.title: Counting Sort: The Video
item.content:encoded: Counting sort can be one of the fastest sorting algorithms...or it can be the slowest! In this in-depth video, we'll dive into what all of this means.

item.title: Bogosort: Sorting in the Slow Lane! üê¢
item.content:encoded: Let's explore the whimsical world of Bogosort, a sorting algorithm known for its sheer inefficiency and randomness!

item.title: Pulling Off a Successful Redesign
item.content:encoded: Redesign projects always start off with great fanfare, but very few such projects successfully cross the finish line. Let's talk about how to increase our chances of success here.

item.title: Creating Your Own Perfect Timing
item.content:encoded: It‚Äôs easy to have a great idea. It‚Äôs easy to turn this great idea into a product. What is not easy is getting the timing right. Let's dive deeper into why timing is hard to figure out and describe some ways we can get better at it.

item.title: Radix Sort
item.content:encoded: Discover Radix Sort, a fast and efficient algorithm for sorting integers. This article explains how it works, its benefits, and provides clear implementation examples.

item.title: Making Counting Sort Work with Negative Values
item.content:encoded: By default, counting sort does not work with negative values. It doesn't have to be that way, so let's look at why this is the case and how to fix it to work with both negative and positive values.

item.title: Diving Deep into Array Index Positions
item.content:encoded: Learn all about index positions and how they help us read, write, and manipulate data in our arrays.

item.title: The Career Three-Body Problem
item.content:encoded: The (career) three-body problem is an impossible to solve puzzle where we try to find balance between competing objectives in our professional lives.

item.title: Counting Sort
item.content:encoded: Counting sort can be one of the fastest sorting algorithms...or it can be the slowest! In this in-depth tutorial, we'll dive into what all of this means.

item.title: Work on Problems You Deeply Care About
item.content:encoded: To be effective as a Product Manager, you should work on problems you personally care about. Doing so makes your job as a PM much easier...and also more enjoyable!

item.title: The Importance of Finding a Career Mentor
item.content:encoded: Think of a career mentor as your personal career friend and advisor, helping you reach your work goals. Let's talk about why it is important for you to find one!

item.title: Creating a Random Walk Simulation üöÄ
item.content:encoded: Learn to create a random walk simulation in JavaScript, exploring concepts, practical applications, and customization options for diverse simulations.

item.title: What is Product Strategy?
item.content:encoded: One of the most important skills for Product Managers to master is product strategy. It is a core requirement before a PM rises to the more senior ranks of the profession. Let's dive into this all-important topic further!

item.title: Thinking about an 8K Resolution Future! üì∫
item.content:encoded: What is the deal with 8K and what can we do to prepare ourselves for it?

item.title: Creating an Animated 3D Starfield Effect
item.content:encoded: Learn how to create this fun effect where we simulate us flying past endless stars in outer space.

item.title: Meet the Default Sorting Algorithms
item.content:encoded: Meet the default sorting algorithms used by popular programming languages!

item.title: Bogosort
item.content:encoded: Explore the whimsical world of Bogosort, a sorting algorithm known for its sheer inefficiency and randomness.

item.title: Remapping Values
item.content:encoded: Learn how to use a remap function to transform a value from one range to another!

item.title: Getting Started with Learning Data Structures and Algorithms
item.content:encoded: Learning data structures and algorithms doesn't have to be a drag. It can be intuitive and fun, and I describe why my content may be just what you need!

item.title: Tech Slowdown Explained, Part 1: Interest Rates üí∏
item.content:encoded: Part 1 of our deep dive into how well-reasoned economic policies led to a slowdown in the tech sector.

item.title: Easily Draw any Polygon
item.content:encoded: Learn how to draw any polygon, ranging from one with just a few sides to a bazillion sides, using a handy trigonometric technique involving a virtual circle.

item.title: Changing Colors in an SVG Element Using CSS and JavaScript
item.content:encoded: Almost everything inside an inline SVG image is up for modification using CSS and JavaScript. Let's find out how by changing some colors!

item.title: Stability and Sorting Algorithms
item.content:encoded: Learn what the stability property of sorting algorithms does and why it is important.

item.title: Creating a Scrollable DIV Area
item.content:encoded: Learn the basics of how to take a div element and make it scrollable with our mouse or fingers.

item.title: Realistic CSS Animations and the linear() Timing Function! üç±
item.content:encoded: Realistic animations are now closer than ever with the new linear() CSS easing function.

item.title: Visualizing Recursion with the Sierpinski Triangle
item.content:encoded: Dive into the amazing world of recursion with the Sierpinski Triangle! Unravel the magic of patterns within patterns as we break down this cool concept visually.

item.title: Insertion Sort: A Deep Dive
item.content:encoded: Learn all about how insertion sort and its simple approach to sorting data works.

item.title: Fast Sorting with Quicksort
item.content:encoded: Learn all about the quicksort algorithm in this beginner-friendly tutorial. Quicksort is a divide-and-conquer sorting algorithm that is known for its efficiency. This tutorial will walk you through the steps of quicksort, with clear explanations and examples.

item.title: The Monty Hall Problem
item.content:encoded: The Monty Hall problem is a probability puzzle where a counterintuitive strategy of switching doors teaches people the importance of understanding conditional probabilities and the advantage of updating their initial choices based on new information.

item.title: Stacks in JavaScript
item.content:encoded: Learn how to use stacks in JavaScript efficiently by exploring the fundamentals, implementation techniques, and real-world applications of this awesome LIFO structure.

item.title: Depth-First Search (DFS) and Breadth-First Search (BFS)
item.content:encoded: Learn all about how Depth-First Search (DFS) and Breadth-First Search (BFS) will allow you to fully traverse and explore a graph. Yes, you also have a fully functioning JavaScript implementation.

item.title: Introduction to the Graph Data Structure
item.content:encoded: Learn the fundamentals of the graph data structure with this beginner-friendly tutorial. Discover how graphs model relationships, their relationship to Trees, and how to implement one fully in JavaScript.

item.title: Big-O Notation and Complexity Analysis
item.content:encoded: Demystify the Big-O notation and its impact on helping us analyze the time and space complexity of a piece of code, an algorithm, or a data structure operation.

item.title: Introduction to Data Structures
item.content:encoded: Data structures are the fundamental building blocks of modern-day programming. Learn more about what they are and why they matter.

item.title: Arrays: A Data Structure Deep Dive
item.content:encoded: Master the art of efficient data manipulation and access with arrays, a foundational part of almost every programming language!

item.title: Hashtables: A Deep Dive into Efficient Data Storage and Retrieval
item.content:encoded: Learn how hashtables leverage hashing functions to store and retrieve information with lightning-fast speed, ensuring constant-time performance for key-based operations.

item.title: Understanding the Trie Data Structure üß∏
item.content:encoded: Unlock the power of the trie data structure with this comprehensive article that explores its inner workings, essential operations, and the myriad of ways it excels in applications like text processing, autocomplete systems, spell-checking algorithms, and countless scenarios involving string manipulation.

item.title: Embracing Generative AI with Open Arms! üß∏
item.content:encoded: Generative AI isn't here to replace us. It is here to act as a force multiplier for our existing skills. Don't fight it. Embrace it.

item.title: Impact of AI on UI/UX Design with Chloe Barreau üé®
item.content:encoded: With AI gaining increased capabilities around generating visuals and simplifying complex UI and UX tasks, what we see and how we interact with our computing devices is going to be very different in the future. To go deeper into the creative, technical, and societal impact of this, I chat with Chloe Barreau.

item.title: Heap Data Structure
item.content:encoded: The heap data structure is just what we need to find the best of something, especially if it needs to be done fast...and in style!

item.title: Binary Search Trees
item.content:encoded: Discover the ultimate tool for efficient searching and sorting - binary search trees! Learn how this powerful data structure works and how it can be applied to solve real-world problems in just a few simple steps.

item.title: Binary Tree Traversal
item.content:encoded: Learn how we can use the breadth-first and depth-first traversal approaches to explore every node in our tree.

item.title: Alphabetically Sort Names in an Array
item.content:encoded: In this exercise, we will learn how to alphabetically sort names in an array by using the built-in Array.sort() method in JavaScript!

item.title: Overlapping Elements on Top of Each Other
item.content:encoded: Overlapping elements using CSS is no longer the stuff of nightmares. We'll look at how to do this elegantly by using the CSS grid.

item.title: Developer Relations and Beyond with Jamie Barton! üöÄ
item.content:encoded: Developer relations is about building relationships between developers and companies! Who better to discuss this with than Jamie Barton?!

item.title: A Trip Down Memory Lane üíæ
item.content:encoded: Let's dive into the fun world of memory management, native programming languages, and managed programming languages.

item.title: Binary Trees
item.content:encoded: üå≥ Get to know Binary Trees: the gateway data structure for efficient searching (üîç), sorting (üìö), and storage (üì¶) of data in computer science! ‚ö°Ô∏è

item.title: Linked List
item.content:encoded: Discover the basics of linked lists, a fundamental data structure in computer science, which stores and manages data in a sequential manner through linked nodes quickly and efficiently.

item.title: The Present and Future of AI Tools with Ray (aka devbyrayray)
item.content:encoded: Today, we'll be diving deep with Ray (of devbyrayray fame!) into the fascinating world of AI and discussing how it's shaping the future of the tools we use as developers.

item.title: "Guess the Number" and Binary Searching! üîç
item.content:encoded: Putting some words and formality to an approach for finding things that you and I have probably been using for quite some time!

item.title: Binary Trees
item.content:encoded: Learning about binary trees is essential for anyone interested in efficient data storage, searching and sorting, as it provides a powerful foundation for building more complex data structures in computer science.

item.title: Switching Web Hosts in 2023 üò±
item.content:encoded: A few weeks ago, I switched web hosting providers on a live site...and it all worked out! ü¶© This exercise brings up something bigger around the role of web hosting providers today. I go deeper into this in my latest newsletter post!

item.title: SVG: Converting a Shape to a Path
item.content:encoded: Learn two approaches for turning your SVG shapes into paths that you can then use as part of your HTML and CSS creations!

item.title: The Versatility of SVGs üåÄ
item.content:encoded: SVG is the gift that keeps on giving...and giving!

item.title: Spinning Circular Text
item.content:encoded: Learn how to create a dynamic and eye-catching spinning circle text effect using HTML, CSS, and SVG.

item.title: Introduction to Trees
item.content:encoded: The tree data structure is important in programming as it provides a hierarchical organization of data that can be efficiently searched, sorted, and processed, making it a fundamental tool for many algorithms and applications.

item.title: Faster Searching with Binary Search
item.content:encoded: Search items at a blazing log(n) speed by learning how binary search works, how it can be implemented, its performance details, and more.

item.title: Search Algorithms and Linear Search
item.content:encoded: Learning how to find something is an important programming skill, and we're going to dip our toes into the fun world of search algorithms by looking deeply at linear search.

item.title: Fibonacci and Going Beyond Recursion
item.content:encoded: When it comes to getting a deep-dive into recursion and how to address its shortcomings, we can't find a better example than the classic Fibonacci sequence. Learn all about it here!

item.title: Guess the Number
item.content:encoded: Take a trip down the fun side and learn how to build the classic 'Guess the Number' game using nothing but HTML, CSS, and JavaScript!
